HelpXML.Title: ncx2mixtcdf
HelpXML.Purpose: ncx2mixtcdf cumulative distribution function (cdf) of a linear combination of non-central chi-square (+ sigma * N(0,1))
HelpXML.Description:
given random variable $Q$ defined as
\[ Q = \lambda_1 \chi^2_1 + \lambda_2 \chi_2 + ... + \lambda_k \chi_k +\sigma X_0 \]
where $\chi^2_1, ..., \chi^2_k$ are $k$ non central chi squared random variables, with non centrality parameters $\delta_1, ..., \delta_k$ and degrees of freedom $df_1, ..., df_k$. and $X_0$ is a standard normal random variable, the purpose of this routine is to compute $F_Q(x | df, delta) = P(Q < x)$ , that is the cdf of $Q$ evaluated at $x$. --------------------------------

Item.Name: c
Item.ShortDesc: value for which cdf has to be computed
Item.LongDesc: Value at which the cdf must be evaluated

Item.Name: n
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length k containing the degrees of freedom of the k non central chi2 distributions

Item.Name: lb
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length k containing the coefficients of the linear combinations of the k non central chi2 distributions

Item.Name: nc
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length k containing the k non centrality parameters of the k non central chi2 distributions

Item.Name: sigma
Item.LongDesc: Coefficient associated with standard deviation of the standard normal distribution which can be added to the linear combination of non central chi2 distributions The default value of sigma is 0

Item.Name: lim
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which defines maximum number of integration terms. The default value of lim is 10000

Item.Name: tol
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which controls the tolerance. The default value of tolerance is 1e-09

Item.Name: qfval
Item.LongDesc: $qfval=F_Q(x | df, delta, sigma)$ is the value of the cdf of the mixture evaluated at x

Item.Name: varargout
Item.TypeInd: FULL STOP MISSING IN THE OUTPUT DESCRIPTION
Item.LongDesc: Tracert(1) = absolute sum tracert(2) = total number of integration terms tracert(3) = number of integrations tracert(4) = integration interval in final integration tracert(5) = truncation point in initial integration tracert(6) = standard deviation of initial convergence factor tracert(7) = number of iterations needed to locate integration parameters ifault : scalar which informs about output of the procedure ifault=0 everything went OK ifault=1 required accuracy not achieved ifault=2 round-off error possibly significant ifault=3 invalid parameters (df or non centr parameters smaller than 0 or lmin=lmax=sigma=0) ifault=4 unable to locate integration parameters

References.Item: Davies (1973), Numerical inversion of a characteristic function, vol. 60, Biometrika, pp. 415-417
Davies (1980), The distribution of a linear combination of Chi^2 Random variables, Applied Statistics vol. pp. 323-333

Item.Title: cdf of two chi squared rv.
Item.Desc: Evaluate the cdf of the sum of two chi2 r.v. with degrees of freedom 5 and 4 and coefficients of the linear combination 2 and 3 and non centrality parameters 1 and 6

Item.Title: cdf of the sum of two non central chi2.
Item.Desc: Evaluate the cdf of the sum of two chi2 r.v. with degrees of freedom 5 and 4 and coefficients of the linear combination 2 and 3 and non centrality parameters 1 and 6. Evaluate the cdf in a series of values of x and plot the output

Item.Title: Test tolerance.
Item.Desc: Example which tests the results using different tolerances and a different number of integration terms
